description: GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 1974 Chevrolet Corvette for purchase. The C3 generation of Corvettes ran from 1968 to 1982, but had some various changes throughout the run of the Stingray. With gov't restrictions killing off muscle cars the stingray had to transition to more of a cruiser. A Chevrolet advertisement headlined: "We gave it radials, a quieter ride, guard beams and a nose job." Improvements to body mounts and interior did improve the Corvette's ride and interior noise was reduced by 40%. Today, C3 Corvettes are some of the best buys in the classic automobile world. These cars were incredibly popular and provide a great ride with plenty of available spare parts. Get behind the wheel and have some classic fun in a Stingray!

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 1974 Chevrolet Corvette for consideration. Coming to you in the original color of Dark Green Metallic, this Vette shows very well and sure does shine after receiving a full exterior and interior detailing. Powered by the always reliable 350 cubic inch V8 and paired with a 4-speed manual transmission. According to our vehicle intake inspection; all of the vehicles glass, wheels, lights (headlights high and low, taillights, turn signals), wipers, heater, horn, seat function, radio, windows and door locks are in good condition and all functioning as they should. With spare parts inexpensive and readily available, C3 Corvettes are a steal as far as classic cars go that can provide such a fun driving experience while turning heads down the road. Don't miss your opportunity to own this affordable American muscle car. A great find for those who love the 70's era Corvette and enjoy a uniquely beautiful ride to enjoy, call us with any questions you may have while it's still here!
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

title: 1971 Chevrolet Corvette

description: This tastefully modified 1964 Chevrolet Corvette Coupe has been owned by the same West Michigan man since 1975! 42 years later and he has decided to finally part with it as he just doesn't drive it as much as he used to. He purchased it from a Michigan State Trooper who owned it since new. Over the years, he has had it restored with a new frame, new paint, rebuilt motor, etc. and as it stands today for sale, it is one-cool machine. Only 8,304 Coupes were built in 1964, which was less than the convertibles.     This mid-year Vette is finished in factory Riverside Red (923) and has that beautiful fastback sloping rear end. It is powered by a rebuilt numbers matching RC block 327ci/250hp V8 mated to a 4-speed manual gearbox that has been upgraded with a Hurst shifter. It runs extremely well and is a blast to drive (be sure to watch video). Other upgrades include a high rise Holley Carb, chrome spoke wheels with new tires, new brakes, and fiberglass leaf springs. The most noticeable alteration is the front of the car. The often problematic pop-up headlights ave been completely removed with lower lights installed in the grill. It has always been stored in a climate controlled facility and remains rust-free (see undercarriage photos).     You will be hard-pressed to find another C2 that has been owned by the same man since 1975. It even comes with the original Michigan title issues in '75. The car is mechanically and cosmetically sound, and ready is now ready for a new garage. Call or e-mail if interested. Thank you for looking.    VIN Decoder: 40837S120803  4 - Year: 1964  08 - Series: Corvette  37 - Body: Coupe  S - Assembly Plant: St. Louis, MO  120803 - Production Sequence     Engine Serial Number Decoder: 4120803F0609RC  4 - Year: 1964  120803 - Production Sequence  F - Assembly Plant: Flint, MI  0609 - Date: June 9th  RC - Carburetor and Transmission: 327-cid 250-hp V-8 with 10.5:1 compression ratio, manual transmission, and four-barrel carburetor
title: 1964 Chevrolet Corvette

description: Gateway Classic Cars is proud to offer this 1974 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray coated in Bright Yellow at our Philadelphia showroom!  This 1974 L82 features the original 350 CID V8 and a top-notch TH-350 automatic transmission that will have you down the road in no time!  Looking at the exterior of this sweet ride can certainly bring back memories for those who grew up with these cars and will certainly make new ones for the next owner!  Take note of the rear of this car and Corvette enthusiasts will tell you that this is perhaps the defining feature of a 1974 model.  A new rear bumper system was put into place that year to pass Federal impacts tests.  For this year only, a vertical center seam on the rear can be seen on all 1974 Corvettes including this one! Everything on this Corvette works extremely well including the Air Conditioning and headlights that still function on the factory vacuum system!  DonÃ¢??t want the A/C on?  Why not let the wind in your hair as youÃ¢??re driving this classic down the road with the option of T-tops or Power Windows! Nestle yourself in this Deluxe interior featuring the original medium Saddle leather color that pairs beautifully with the yellow exterior!  How can you not picture yourself behind the wheel of this classic?!  This is a true driver and is ready to go to your next cruise or show!  The next step is to make it yours today! Additional features on this gorgeous vehicle are Corvette wheels, AM/FM Radio with cassette, Power Brakes and Power Steering!  To view this 1974 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray in greater detail, including HD pictures and an HD video, visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com or our Philadelphia showroom located in West Deptford, NJ, which is just minutes away from Philadelphia, PA. For more information, please call 856-599-4100 or email Philadelphia@GatewayClassicCars.com

description: Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1975 Corvette T-Top Coupe. Hagerty Values a number #2 car like this at $15,800 and a number #3 car at $11,500. Own this 1975 Corvette today for a fraction of blue book value!  HISTORY  The third generation Corvette, patterned after the Mako Shark II concept car, was introduced for the 1968 model year and was in production until 1982. C3 coupes featured the first use of T-top removable roof panels. It introduced monikers that were later revived, such as LT-1, ZR-1, Z07 and Collector Edition. In 1978, the Corvette's 25th anniversary was celebrated with a two-tone Silver Anniversary Edition and an Indy Pace Car replica edition of the C3. This was also the first time that a Corvette was used as a Pace Car for the Indianapolis 500. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA  SPECIFICS / BUILD INFORMATION  EXTERIOR   -Bright Red paint.  -T-Tops.   -Classic Corvette styling.   -Luggage Rack.   -Rallye Wheels. Excellent condition.   INTERIOR   -Dark Red Bucket seats.   -Red Carpet.   -Black Dash.  MECHANICAL   -383 Stroker V8.      -3-Speed Automatic.   -M/T Valve Covers.   -4 Barrel Carb.   DISCLOSURE  -There are a few chips / imperfections in the paint. (See detailed pictures)  -Arrangements can be made to acquire the ORIGINAL 350 V8 upon buyer request. (Contact Sales Agent)  For more details on any disclosure items please contact a sales agent today at 1-877-422-2940.    Own this vintage 1975 Chevrolet Corvette at wholesale cost. The cost of parts and restoration of these vehicles are increasing daily. Buy one complete and ensure your investment for the future. Don't do the work yourself, get one finished for roughly half of the cost of building it yourself!   An excellent investment and something you can enjoy daily. Collectible vintage vehicles have historically appreciated at a rate greater than that stock market, gold and other arts and collectibles as documented by many articles and auction result tracking.     NEED MORE DETAILED INFORMATION? CALL US AND WE WILL HELP ANY WAY POSSIBLE!   1-877-422-2940  WORLDWIDE VINTAGE AUTOS [. C O M ]     FINANCING:  JJ BEST BANC. COLLECTOR CAR FINANCING  800-872-1965  Please mention you are working with Worldwide Vintage Autos in order to expedite the process.  DEPOSITS:  Deposits to hold vehicles is $500. Upon payment of the $500 deposit, the vehicle will be held for 7 days pending final payment. Deposits are non-refundable due to i). the vehicles are taken off the market and we turn down other buyers during the 7 day period and ii). there is significant re-marketing costs associated with relisting / remarketing our vehicles. Inspections should be performed prior to putting a deposit down on a vehicle.   INSPECTIONS:  We encourage inspections. We disclose known defects and imperfections but we are not you. Purchasing a vehicle is very subjective. Come visit our showroom in Denver, CO, we would love to meet you in person!  SHIPPING:  We recommend having our shipping coordinator facil
title: 1975 Chevrolet Corvette

description: The 1968 Corvette Sting Ray sported all-new styling and was based on the Mako Shark II concept car. The design is bold, the Sting Ray is for those who appreciate the true sports car. It's that special kind of an automobile that comes along about once every generation to totally arrest the imagination of car buffs. The '68 Sting Ray Coupe is a hardtop and more. Uncommon removable sections over the pilot and navigator lift out for open air moving. A nearly vertical glass rear window tucks out of the way into a neat compartment in the luggage area. The effect is a flow-through roof that had never been seen in an American production sports car until now. Functional louvers behind the front wheels help keep the horses cool. Wraparound front and rear bumpers plus line-smoothing hideaway features help make this Corvette a trim one style-wise. On the nose end, vacuum-operated headlights glide open automatically when lights are turned on. Windshield wipers aren't around when they shouldn't be. They're hidden under a power-operated panel which actuates when wipers are turned on or off. Wheels were one inch wider and the rear roll center was lower allowing the car to corner and hug the roads with more ease. This Corvette has the 327ci Turbo-Fire V8 Engine that produces 350 hp & 360 lb-ft torque paired to the optional 4-Speed Manual Transmission. We're offering this 1968 Chevrolet Corvette Coupe draped in a FRESH NEW coat of RALLY RED paint over BLACK VINYL with only 81,855 miles and includes the factory optional 4-SPEED MANUAL TRANSMISSION and an AFTER-MARKET EXHAUST. This vehicle includes the Owner's Manual, 2 Sets of Keys, Service Records and Floor Mats. Comes comprehensively serviced and detailed by our highly regarded Bosch Authorized Service Facility. Trades Welcome.
title: 1968 Chevrolet Corvette
